item.title: !nu !numma-!kuiten
item.summary: !nu!numma–!kuíten, who fetches crying children. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-29. 8555-8560). Parents threaten their misbehaving children with !nu !numma-!kuiten (or 'White Mouth'), who kills children who cry.
item.comments: 1) p.8554v: |han≠kass'o heard this from his maternal grandfather (Tsatsi); what !nu !numma and !kuiten means, 2) See Spoken of a parrot in the village of Mowbray, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-29
item.author: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)

keyword.subkw: what |han≠kass'o's grandfather Tsatsi told him about
was formerly a beast of prey
fetches and kills children who cry
and !kotta koe, who was a man
who cry are killed and eaten by !nu !numma-!kuiten
what |han≠kass'o's grandfather Tsatsi told him about !nu !numma-!kuiten
what his grandfather Tsatsi told him about !nu !numma-!kuiten
